text: Great place for Brunch!  Friendly staff.  Try the California Benedict you will Love it!

Hello yelp fans, long time listener, 1st time caller!
What was not to like about this place. We came in a little late, kitchen food was perfect. 
Had shrimp app., bruschetta app, and chicken strips with mac & cheese.
Shrimp, awesome, took some home. Bruschetta fantastic sauce & presentation.  The chicken tenders white breast meat lightly breaded, I got the sauce and blue cheese on the side. A very generous portion, the Mac & cheese was not as cheesy (soupy) as I like, but loved the jalape√±o peppers in it.
The beer was good & cold both drafts and bottles. I would love to see them get a larger selection of craft beers on tap, but that's just me! 
Our sever Lauren, very sweet, polite, friendly, and kept the beer flowing, even though she was the only one behind the bar for all of the restaurant.
Great Job Lauren!
Just traveling through by myself, everyone made me feel as if a regular, nice hometown bar atmosphere! Plenty of TVs for any sporting event! 
Next time through; " I'll be back!".
Horrible service. Felt rushed. Gave us a check before we finished eating and before asking if we wanted anything.

Service and food has gone down hill.  Friends and I have met here once or twice a month over the last five years. Patio and bar service has gotten progressively worse. We've waited 5-10 minutes for anyone to attend our table and/or booth if in bar.  Note this:  during happy hour, appetizers are smaller in size. Some dinners are smaller now as well.  Also a draft pint might be $3.50 but a larger size is $8.00 (servers don't tell you, you'd get more to order two pints, than the larger).  Food is served without plates, napkins, utensils.  Third time for disappointment; we'll go elsewhere now.

Recently relocated to Scottsdale for work, and coming from the South, I have been in search for good food, good company, and access to SEC sports!

I found it all here- all of the bar food basics, elevated, and some other dishes that may surprise you!!

Nice, covered, dog friendly patio with numerous tvs- the bonus? Your server will bring a speaker box to the table so you can actually HEAR the game that you are focusing on!

This will definitely be a go to sports bar and grill for me!

Always great service. Good food. Love the free shuttle service home.
Can't say enough good things about Ko's.

I work near KO's and it's lunchtime favorite. This place is a hidden gem. It features a huge and social bar along with a large room of booths/tables. The food is top notch and their menu is enormous. I haven't tried everything but they haven't missed yet. Their burgers are really, really good and cooked to perfection. The salads are huge and very tasty. I love that you can have your protein made "cajun" and added to any salad. I had some potato skins the other day that were fantastic. I didn't know going in but they are on the happy hour menu and only cost me $4.44! Good beer selection that seems to change often as well.
First time here..... Won't be our last! Food was awesome and definitely scratch made. Southwest melt was fabulous!
Jessica is awesome I love her! Great cold beer and a good way to spend any night of the week!

Awesome place! Great customer service every time,  really good menu with tons of options. Tater tots! Good local beers on tap and they always have drink specials. Fun place to watch any sports and bet on a few ponies!

The fries were overdone, i.e. cracker-like, and the pulled pork sliders were too dry for my taste. The grilled chicken was decent and the bloody Mary average. Otherwise, the service and atmosphere were ok.
Good food, bar food, brunch o Sat, and Sun, lots of TV screens. Individual speakers. Ask waiter. Free ride home. IF too much to drink. Lots of beer choices. Poker on sat, always something going on.

ATTENTION ALL PIZZA LOVERS-  not you fake pizza lovers who think real pizza is pizza hut or papa johns -  this place has outstanding pizza. i'm originally from the northeast and i can't stand fake or fast food pizza. i've been on a mission for 25 years to find the best pizza in arizona. this place is in my top 2 of all pizzas  i've had in 30 years here. it's a cool place with lots plasmas around the restaurant and bar. the restaurant and bar are separated so you can go here for drinks with friends and be stupid or sit with your family and have a great dining experience in the restaurant.  it's sports orientated. the pizza is large and just all around back east. really authentic flavor.  the ribs are really good. they have a full menu of italian, ribs, chicken, burgers, appetizers, etc... . during happy hour, which is 7 days a week, you can get half off appetizers whether you are sitting in the bar or restaurant. good, fun, quality place. great food all the way around. great place to watch sports.

I'll make my first review a positive one.  KO's is my families' go to restaurant.   The servers and managers are always polite and friendly.  It's a nice mix between bar and restaurant atmosphere, so my kids love it.  There are time when you wonder if your server is ever coming back, especially when they are busy, but overall, the good food, service, atmosphere and price make this a solid pick.

I love this place!   It's close to my office so I probably frequent it once a week for lunch.    They have a varied menu so there are plenty of options for all palates.    While a burger is usually my staple here, I was feeling froggy today and decided to change it up.   I ordered the grilled chicken wings and they were delicious.    Plus, I love the fact that the owner walks around ensuring his customers are happy.  Haven't done a happy hour here yet but it's on the list...

Monday night.  Best pizza special in town. Half off all medium and large  pizza. 

We ordered a sausage and mushroom. Well done. Excellent pizza.  

Great TV
Lots of room to watch the game 

Best thing about KO'S is the high level of service.  Be a regular. Have fun. You will become like family and you will always be welcome

K O'Donnell's is my opinion the best sports bar and grill in North Scottsdale. I am not in the restaurant/bar business, but I go out enough to know that it is very hard for an establishment of this type to "get it right".

I am sure that there is much more to it, but it would seem like the major elements to success would be a good location, facility, product offering, people, and probably most important, good ownership. This place seems to have all of that. Conveniently located, a comfortable bar and restaurant with booths, a large covered patio, a great menu with quality food, countless TVs for sports, and a very friendly and attentive staff. Hard to find a place where you are comfortable watching football, having a business lunch, hosting an event, smoking a cigar or even bringing kids for dinner.

If you have not been to KO's, it's well worth a try!

My office is right down the street from here and it is definitely in my list of go to's for the nearby lunch circuit. 

The atmosphere is nice... Definitely a sports bar but I like how the dining area is separated from the bar. Both the bar area and restaurant feed out to the large patio which has mist system for summer and a nice fireplace for the cooler temps. I'm not sure if they use that though cause I've only been there for lunch. 

The service is friendly and usually you can get sat and eat pretty fast. Everything I've had on the menu has been pretty good and the people that I've been here with have said the same. They have some specialty items along with the usual sandwiches, burgers, pizza, etc. 

I would recommend this place to people looking for a nice sit down lunch spot. I don't know that I would to go hang out to watch a game because I've never been there other than lunch and don't know what the crowd is like or if they are busy. 

I know they have some special events also. I think the owner is a pro poker player so they have poker nights and other events that look to be pretty fun time.

KO's is by far our most favorite spot to go for dinner. No matter what you get the food is fantastic - overall very consistent quality. A must have is the fried cheesecake! 
The staff is always outgoing and super friendly.  Overall just a great atmosphere with incredible people and delicious food.
Phenomenal bar! Xcllent bartender "Taylor" had drinks and pizza ALL GREAT! HAPPY HOUR PRICES - OH YES!

When my friend and I walked in we were greeted by a pleasant young woman who took us to the nearest table to be seated, I requested a booth since most restaurant chairs bother my back, I want to be comfortable while I dine.
The manager came out to take our drink order, and walked away, however returned before she was out of sight to take our appetizer order. 
When the mozzarella sticks came they appeared to be half cooked at best, the manager took them back to the kitchen and appeared a reasonable amount of time later with freshly made mozzarella sticks that were quite good, although I was less than impressed with the marinara dipping sauce which was a dull cloudy light red color.  
I ordered the steak fajitas, while my friend ordered the blackened cajun chicken alfredo.
The food came out in a timely manner, however the meats on both plates were bland, overcooked and dry.  The fajitas came with plenty of topping options, and are a good size, however lacked seasoning and having been overcooked were dry and tough. 
The alfredo was bland even after salting the food, there was no flavor to be found. The lumpy bland alfredo, with the overcooked dry tough chicken as a whole was just not good. It tasted like something I would microwave out of the frozen food section.
The server, or manager did not check with either my friend or I with the quality of the entrees, and I had to repeatedly ask a server, or hostess to get my server or the manager.  
When the server asked if we wanted boxes for the largely untouched plates, I replied it would be up to my friend as I had no interest in the food there, nor would I want to take it home.  
The manager returned, and asked what I needed, I asked her to take the food back to the cook and let him taste the bland pasta, lumpy alfredo, the overcooked chicken and steak.  She did at that point agree that the alfredo was a little on the bland side, and took the dishes to the kitchen.
Ten to fifteen minutes later, with no response from the manager, my friend and I walked to the hostess station, and I asked if the manager would be returning to follow up with our table.  I'm thinking we should be given the check, some sort of something so that we no longer had to sit at this table.  The manager replied quite snootily that since the mozzarella sticks had come out uncooked the first time, they took that off our bill, and she had told the cook about the concerns I had with my food, so there was no bill.
I really would have valued attentive service, instead of having to chase around a snotty manager, and above all- I would have appreciated food with flavor.
I will not be back to this establishment, not just for the problems with the food, but also the attitude of the manager in particular.

A very good variety of food on their menu, great place to watch sports with all of the TV's and very happy with the service and staff. 
I have been here a few times and each time I'm very happy with the food and service. It's a great place in North Scottsdale!

Seeing as know the owners my review might be just a litle biased, and at the same time I see how hard they work to provide excellent food, drink, customer service and continuously improve their operation.  Awesome food, free poker three nights a week (with a chance to win a seat to the World Series of Poker) , countless TV's and a high energy, friendly staff are just a few reasons to visit KO's.
K O'Donnell's has become one of my local favorite hangouts. The food is good the service has been great. Your entire staff is awesome however Jessica one of your bartenders has became my favorite.
You must ask Stephanie behind the bar for the most amazing wing conbo    It's off the menu so ask for Honey Hot mixed with barbecue!! Amazing!!!

Good food.  Good atmosphere.  Our server was very good and enthusiastic.
Expected more diverse items on menu.
Paige was great and very attentive.  My wife and I have been going to KOs for wings for the last 8 years. The rest of the menu is great too. Give them a shot. You will have a good time.

My family is in Phoenix for the weekend and came to K'Os due to really good reviews on various sites. I am unsure how this place has received much positive at all. In all honesty, we didn't find much good. The chicken tenders were extremely
boring and underwhelming, barbecue chicken pizza on the dull side, decent tater tots but nothing special.
Music was mostly out of date but there were a few good songs played. Tv situation is already not great and far away for most people, as well as having weird channels like QVC. For people living in the area, might not be horrible to go once in a long while, but visitors to Arizona, I don't recommend wasting a meal here.

Love the food, atmosphere and local people hanging out.  But most of all, my wife and I always look foe Candyce.  She is the best server.  Remembers us every time, remembers what we drink and eat.  Really cool and makes us feel welcome.

After recently moving, I have been to this restaurant twice. I went once for a business lunch, which was surprisingly pleasant. The service during the morning shift was "ok" but nothing special. The food tasted great and came out beautifully. However, when we  returned for dinner one night, it was a completely different experience. The food was still good, but the service in the bar area was slow and lacked customer service. When the manager brought out our food, the body oder from him was horrific!! I dreaded every time he walked by our table, or came over to ask how the food was; it was literally nauseating! Then, I guess his shift had ended because he sat at the bar with a group of men who treated the restaurant like a trashy bumbling bar. I suppose it was my own fault for assuming that professionalism would continue on the dining-bar area. Whether or not the "manager" is off his shift, I shouldn't have to watch him get highly intoxicated and inappropriate just because his shift has ended... Very disappointed in the owners for allowing this to take place.
Solid sports bar. Everyone in the group enjoyed their meal. Service was good and friendly.  Would definitely be back in the future!

I have been coming here quite often recently. This is by far one of the best bars I've been to. Service is beyond nice and accommodating; food is great quality and delicious; and the drink selection and serving is always just right. 

The best sports bar in Arizona beyond doubt, and one of the best bars overall in town. 

Keep in mind.. Don makes Ghandi look like a worthless son of a bitch. You'll never meet anyone better. One could only wish Don was their father, mother, lover, etc. He knows music from the 70s but looks like he grew up in the 80s! Claims to play golf but only has one hole-in-one... 

I've had nothing but the best service and coldest beers at K O's, thanks guys!

They have a shuttle bus 6-2 a.m.!!!  Woohoo, can't beat that! 

Happy hour til 7!!  Woohoo, can't beat that!

Poker tues/thurs!!  Woohoo, can't be that!

A+ Brushetta!! Woohoo, can't beat that!

Service not to shabby!! Woohoo, can't beat that!

Veggie Burger Was Delicious 
Service was great - Thank you to our server Rachel

No other place in north Scottsdale to watch football or sports. Food is extraordinarily delicious and service is amazing. You never want for food or drink when Laura is working. She makes sure you have all you need for a great night. I feel like family here. Did I mention the food is amazing? Drink specials every day and brunch that is the best breakfast in the valley on saturdays and sundays. Get to KOs you won't be sorry.
Great food and prompt service!  For a sports bar the food rivals very good restaurants and sometimes come here just for the food!  Will be back many times!  Prime rib anything is excellent!
The Cheers of Scottsdale, where everybody knows your name. Great food, try the weekend brunch menu.

We got to Kos all the time. The food is always amazing and the staff is always friendly. We love having Kaitlyn take care of us on the patio. If your looking for a fun sports bar with a great patio come here. Ask for Kaitlyn she will make your experience great!

Great food and even better service! Our server Lauren was amazing. She was attentive and cheerfully talked us through the menu, as this was our first time here. She made our day a little bit brighter and we will definitely be coming back and asking for her to be our server. We ordered a delicious pulled pork sandwich and sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries are to die for and we had her box up an extra order of them for us to take home!
best bartenders in any sports bar love the food and atmosphere so entertaining always happy to sit down at the bar and enjoy

I love this place. It's close to home and we go there often. they are very accommodating and the drinks are reasonable and the food is very good. It was great to find a good sports bar here in Scottsdale.  

The pizza is fantastic if you haven't tried it before. 
The Prime Rib Wrap is great.
Burgers (including the turkey burger) are awesome
The grilled wings are awesome as well. 

Also, they have a good brunch on the weekends.

Came here as our last stop before heading to the airport splitting after a great family weekend celebrating moms 50! We enjoyed a great time watching the 49er and many other games play this day! 

We started with the loaded nachos (minus any meat) and potatoe skins minus the bacon. Both were delicious, nachos were full and you can actually taste the beans which is rare! We loved both these dishes!

For lunch, table ordered the: Cajun pasta(no meat) grilled cheese, vegetarian sandwich, enchilada sandwich with black bean party, chicken pesto and the quesadilla (added spinach instead of the cheese). The food was really great for almost all members! It was hot, spicy, and tasty! The Cajun pasta was not very spicy and therefore the older sis was unhappy and the vege sandwich was very dry. Buttttt everything else was like amazing! We all wish there was a place like this in sacramento/california! 

One very important factor in enjoying the game, food and the experience was our waitress! She was super prompt, made all our substitutions perfect(which is hard!) and was super easy going and happy! I really really am sad to head to the airport after such a great meal! I highly recommend this place for any football fans and anyone in desire for a great American meal! Very healthy options too and kid friendly!!!

Just had dinner there with a friend.  Friendly wait staff, good food, decent prices, and close to the Scottsdale Gun Club where my friend and I like to go shooting.

They seated us quickly at a nice table and our waitress was there quickly to ask about drinks and appetizer.  The appetizer did come out wrong as we made a special request for it, but they quickly took it back and brought us out another one the way we ordered it.  

The meals we ordered were very good and I intend to go back.  I especially enjoyed my fish taco's as it is hard to find a place that makes good ones.

I will definitely go back there again!
Went in last night with a group of 25, the food was great, service was great, and our server Taylor was amazing. Will definitely be back!

The buffalo chicken salad is the best in the valley . Lots of fresh ingredients great balance of flavors unbreaded chicken tenders. Every time I come in here the food has been outstanding.  A lot of the items on the menu are cooked from scratch.

I first stopped at this place for a quick bite to eat right after happy hour began.  It was pretty a random choice, since I was in the area, and simply wanted something quick and easy before I headed to Golfsmith.  Since it wasn't busy, I wandered around, and was pleasantly surprised by the place.  The staff was friendly, the patio was nice, and all tables and seats had good views of the TVs.  The menu was extensive, and you could find almost anything you had a taste for.

I had the chicken fingers appetizer with the blackened cajun spice, and they did a first rate job with the seasoning.  Although some places tone down their seasoning, the spice mixture was just right. Although it might be spicy for some tastes, it was just like I cook at home - and very rarely found in a restaurant.  They also had a nice selection of draft beer.

I have since been back several time, and have tried both their pizza and pulled pork.  Both were very well prepared, especially for bar food.  The place was very busy the last two times I was there, but it was very well staffed, and plenty of servers to handle the volume of people. 

As has been noted by others, they also have a shuttle bus, which is a definite plus. It will pick you up and take you home.   I have never used it, but I have talked with others that have, and they all love it.  It is great that the restaurant has that option available.
Really cool place to just eat and watch the game.  Service and food have always been good.  Wish they would open one on the West side of town.

FOOTBALL FANS BEWARE - You can arrive as early as you would like to this bar and even if there is not be a soul in the place, good luck finding a seat or table in the bar as they let people reserve ALL of the bar stools and high tops.  I will admit the food here is pretty good but what a joke, I won't be back.
The chicken pesto sandwich is AMAZING. The service was fantastic especially the hostess Kellie who was very helpful. I will defined be back soon.

If you want a sit-down restaurant for a quick lunch, this is a good place to head. They have some nice (and different) sandwich and salad options including a turkey and brie sandwich and a "biltmore" salad with blue cheese, corn, and baked chicken. 

My biggest gripe is that they keep changing suppliers for their food! My husband and I tend to head here before the movies maybe about once a month. They seem to really have the food down...and then they change it up (have seen this on everything from fries to tortilla chips.) 

Also, if you are looking for a quiet lunch, don't go during a sports game! This place gets pretty noisy with the 20+ TVs going and the fans cheering.
Nice place - drank at the bar and the bartenders were super cool - I'll go again.
Great time at K O'Donnell's with the team. Food was excellent and service was fast - Chris was the best!
I met up with a great friend from High School, Jay Lessard, for the first time tonight. I have to say that the food was amazing and the service was equally as good. I will definitely come here again!
Awesome spot with great food and a huge dog friendly patio! The wings, bruschetta and pretzel bites are all great appetizers to start with. The deluxe mac & cheese is my favorite for dinner!
Stopped in for lunch, had the fish & chips, good service, fish a little overcooked but tasty

This is hands down my favorite Sports Bar! TV's everywhere, cold beer, awesome food and excellent service. The staff at KO's is extremely friendly and they always make you feel welcome. Try the cheeseburger sliders. They're off the hook!!! I love this place!!
Service was awesome, food was awesome. We came in to watch the baseball game and they have a ton of TVs and the MLB package. The wings were the best I've had and the fish tacos were on point.
Great dining experience tonight. Great food and awesome service!  The staff is amazing and love the patio.

I have to say.....  DONT EAT HERE!
the service was ok the food was ok. 
 I brought my son with me for a lunch meeting and thought the place would have been a great place to meet. About halfway through our lunch I begin to have a stomach ache. When finished with my meal I couldn't get to the restroom fast enough!!! I race to the restroom to find no lock on the bathroom stall door! It's gutted out and has obviously been this way for a while due to the dirt and old paint all messed up inside. How much is a lock or little slide lock.??? Then as I blow this throne up someone walked in so you have to cough so they don't open the door and see you blowing it up! I look around and the restroom is filthy! No paper towels! The maintenance on this place is none! I think what does the kitchen look like? Are they just cheap and don't fix or clean anything? 
 Maybe the food just didn't agree with me? I get out to the truck and my son 17 says dad I really need to use the bathroom, my stomach really hurts! Then I'm just really disappointed. Screw this place! Let's go find a place where you can at least lock the stall door! I will never return here for sure!  I wish them the best but please put some money into the he little stuff! 
Thanks rant over!

Great sports bar and grill. We called ahead for seating for 20 after a ballgame. The service was quick and friendly. The food was good. The nachos are huge! The Irish Stew is comfort food! The outside patio had our group set up in two big tables. It was a nice place to celebrate our winning game and enjoy fellowship with the team.

My husband and I, and our two children, love K O'Donnell's Bar and Grill.  Even though "bar" is part of the name, K O'Donnell's is great for families.  If you enjoy sports, this is the place to be... HD TV's everywhere, including in the dining area, but the volume is not overly loud.  The food is wonderful... you can't find a better burger in town for $8.50 (comes with a side, such as salad, fries, or onion rings - which are made perfectly and are delicious).  Our son always orders a slice of pepperoni pizza... it's huge... and only $2.  I've had the Teriyaki Chicken sandwich, which is also a great choice... tender chicken breast marinated in a tangy teriyaki sauce, a thick slice of grilled fresh pineapple, served on a toasted roll... with a side, for $8.50.  The service is awesome; soft drinks are refilled without asking.   The owner has personally greeted us at our table on multiple visits.  The servers pay special attention to kids.   When my son won a Little League championship game last year, and we stopped at K O'Donnell's to celebrate, the staff brought out a complimentary "make-your-own" ice cream sundae, with several small dishes of toppings such as M&M's, sprinkles, chocolate syrup, etc.   My son was thrilled and, needless to say, we keep coming back, knowing that the staff will take care of us.  They just expanded an inviting outdoor patio and we hear that they host live entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights.   I can't say enough about this place... come check it out for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

Great service. Great atmosphere. We were visiting from out of town and were watching the NCAA basketball tournament. Multiple tv's to watch different games at once. The food was fresh, tasteful, and very good.

Found this place from using Yelp.  Fun place and great burgers.  Sat in bar, staff very friendly. Wish it had been a bit warmer as they have a great patio with a fireplace. Will definitely visit again

Happened upon KOs after visiting the Scottsdale Gun Club.  Was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and quality of food.  My brother and I sat at the bar and though they were pretty busy for a Saturday afternoon our bartender was on top of it.  The burger was obviously fresh and not frozen, the pizza had good flavor and a ton of toppings.  The place is not going to blow you away with design or atmosphere, but for a neighborhood sports bar the food is much better than Zipps or Goldies.  Our excitement for the day was your typical 30 year old self entitled Scottsdale male make scene about being charged for the extra tortillas he wanted for his leftovers to go.  Both the bartender and manager handled his temper tantrum well and receive high marks for their patience and professionalism.  Next time we decide to go shooting, we'll be stopping into KOs again!
Best place in the world! Great food and servers! Best University of Arizona game watch bar ever!

Food here is amazing, great atmosphere, and awesome staff. i love sitting on the patio. Either of the two Kaitlyns are my favorite. They always know how to make you have a good time and make you want to come back. they always have a smile on their face and can make you laugh. i love Kos and both the owners are amazing! Such an awesome family owned place.

As a senior citizen, a group of friends and I were treated very disrespectfully and rudely in a recent visit to this establishment. The atmosphere here dictates that if you are not part of the clientele who regularly frequent this overrated "sports bar" you are pretty much relegated to second class status in terms of courtesy and service. It is very "cliquish" and the food is mediocre at best. We paid our bill and left with a vow never to return. Don't waste your time going to this place. There are just too many other dining/entertainment choices in the Scottsdale area that know how to treat their more mature guests with a lot more dignity, respect and better quality food selections.

A real good menu with plenty to choose from. The wings are quite good and the steak was done just rite. Service was five stars. Always a fun, comfortable atmosphere. A great place to stop for some dinner after work, with or without the kids.
A little too loud for me on the weekends. I do love what they call their grownup grilled cheese sandwich.

Well, the food was good, for those of us who were able to get any.

Went with a large group for a friend's birthday, so of course we expected it might take a little longer than normal for everybody to get food and drinks.  No problem, right?  The first bunch of about 6 people that arrived before us got drinks and ordered, cool.  Server (Rory) comes back for the next round, I tell him two of the four of us at the table are with the 3 sitting at the other table, and we order ours.  This is after about 30 minutes, which is what I expected.  Dude never takes their order or even offers them drinks.  Two more parties arrive and he looks right at the still-ignored members and walks past them, serving the other two sets of people.

At the one and a half hour mark, everyone was done eating and they still hadn't even been greeted.  Maybe the philosophy is that if you ignore people with kids long enough, they will leave.  My wife was part of the ignored set, and we had to share entrees with the three of them so that they could eat something...and she was paying, so we had to get the check that he gave to our 6 year old son at another table and give it to her.  When they had brought out the food, they asked her if it was hers and she told the food runners she was still waiting to order.  I guess they didn't give a damn either.

The rest of the group was rather unimpressed as some of them didn't receive additional drinks or refills, and of course they caught that about a quarter of the people with them didn't even get a drink order taken over an hour and a half.  We planned to stay longer and spend 2-3 times as much money (and normally tip 20-25%) but as it was we had to pay our tab so that we could go somewhere else so that we could actually get some food.

Unless you have at least 2 hours to wait just to get greeted if they feel like waiting until the rest of the people with you are done eating, it's not worth showing up to guess whether or not you'll be served.  Screw this place.  Maybe if they do carry out orders it would be worth calling in to get something but there's no way I'm wasting my time showing up to eat or drink there again; I know plenty of other places that will be happy to take my money.

Great Grub, Great Drinks, Great Service!!! Enough said :o)

No wait, I'll say more :o)

This place has customer service nailed across the board!!! My buddies and I felt like King's!!! Hell, some of us even felt like Queens!!!

Any game we wanted, Dasha had us covered! Fire ambiance while we smoked our cigars, CHECK!!! Late night pizza, CHECK!!! Dasha obviously has a degree in customer service and she makes sure her staff operates just as she does. 

And let me tell you about the bar service. Caitlin has you covered from top to bottom! Her prompt and attentive service is a thing of beauty. I know people that would pay hundreds of dollars for that kind of service. 

We look forward to our next visit!!! Keep up the great work ladies. And THANKS again.
I eat here almost once a week. They have great pizza and wings! They delivered the wrong pizza one time but quickly corrected error and were very easy to work with. Great staff!

I have been here a lot as I lived almost walking distance of it for years.  

Unfortunately I haven't been back since they added some new beers, I've heard they now have an IPA which is great to hear.  KO's is a true family owned bar and restaurant which is now run by his daughter.  This is something that I value personally because in Scottsdale everything is corporate.  KO himself is a great guy, and as I result I like spending my money there.  They have poker nights which are always fun along with trivia night which is surprisingly fun.

In terms of food, this is one of those places that has a rather large menu.  Normally I would criticize this but in KO's case I love it.  Often times my girl and I can't figure out what we want for dinner and in those cases heading to KO's is the best option.  You can get Mexican, American, Italian, or whatever you want from the menu.  I've never had a bad meal here and I've ordered just about everything off the menu at this point.  The honey hot wings are my favorite of any wings I've had in the valley and surprisingly the pizza here is very good too.  The sandwiches are great, my girl's go to menu item is the Turkey Bacon Swiss (TBS) which I would recommend myself.  The sweet potato frys here are probably the best I've had in the valley, it one of the few places that actually get them crispy.

The patio is great here, KO allows and sells cigars which I like.  It almost like hanging out in someones backyard but you have all the food and beer at your fingertips.
Once again another exemplary meal.  The service is unsurpassed and the food is consistently excellent.  This is our go-to place

I just don't get it.  This place feels like a TGI Fridays. Okay, maybe the food is a little better, but it just feels tired and outdated to me.  I've heard the breakfasts are good and I've never tried them, but I've just never been impressed.
Food is very bland and the staff seems to be too busy to pay much attention to you. Drinks are also too expensive and mediocre at best. Very dumpy establishment.

The best part of this place is the wait staff. They make the place and it's a good thing because the food seems to be deteriorating with every visit. It is close to home, so I am hoping that they improve the food.

Update:

11/2016

So I've been here twice since my last review (once I sat in the bar area and once in the dining area). The last time I ate here with my coworkers was great. The food was amazing, the nachos were some of the best. The waitress was attentive and the owner (I believe) even came out to say hello and check on my friend/co-worker. I will stand behind my review of the bad service we received at the bar that first night but I believe that one person is not a reflection of this restaurant/bar and the rest of the staff.
Please tell Candace not to give customers their check prior to asking for it. Thanks for cutting my night short.

The food here is really good and we had great service both times. Once during the day, order pork sliders and they were sooooo good. They also had Stoli on special for $4. =) The other time we were there was in the evening, it was chili and we were outside but they had a great fire place that kept our area really cozy. We split the pork chop dinner and it was great too. You have to try the creamed corn! (I try not to eat french fries but they are beyond awesome too LOL)

KO's is a north Scottsdale staple at this point. Its located in the same lot as the Scottsdale Gun Club tucked away on Northsight just north of Raintree. There aren't a lot of options for sports bars in that neck of the woods and I'm happy to report that their food is better than average. I'm a huge fan of their chicken pesto sandwich. French fries, onion rings and chicken tenders are always fried to perfection and served with cold ranch dressing. The atmosphere is pretty casual but still maintains some class with its somewhat eclectic industrial decor. 

Overall, Its a pretty good place to grab lunch and a couple of drinks.

We were looking for a different place to try one night when a craving for burgers struck us.  I referred to my trusty Yelp! app and found this place which is about a mile from where I live.  Walked inside to a very cozy atmosphere.  TV's everywhere for the sports lovers.  They have pretty typical bar food, but they manage to turn it up a notch to gourmet status.  We had the wings which were perfectly spicy, the enchilada burger, and I had the rancher burger.  These burgers were just awesome.  Came with tasty fries and I was a happy girl.  The bartender definitely knew how to pour a healthy drink also!  Will gladly come back here next time I am in the mood for a burger.  The price range is about $10-25/person, depending on how much food you order.

I had never been at K Odonnell's despite seeing 20% off coupons in The Clipper Magazine and driving past it on my way to Sam's.  Went there Saturday night.  They had their misters on for the patio but since the patio allows smoking I didn't want to take a chance that a smoker would sit next to us and puff in my face.  So inside we went.  Within seconds of getting the menu we were asked if you were ready.  I then volunteered that we had never been here before and as a result did not know the menu AND that we needed more time.  I wanted the Pork Green Chle Soup, but was disappointed that they were out of it.  Out of it??? at 7PM on a Saturday night?  Come on now!!!  I then ordered a cup of the Guinness stew and after one tablespoon I knew that this was not for me.  When something needs that much salt and pepper AND tabasco, it's time for a change.  And isn't soup supposed to be hot??  I then got the Chicken Tortilla soup which was really delicious.  My hubby decided he would drink his appetizer.  He ordered a special they had of a bloody mary made with Absolute Peppery Vodka.  I didn't know that type of vodka existed.  The drink was really good!   You didn't think I was just going to have the soup without slurping some of that delicious bloody mary, did you????  The fish and chips I ordered was plentiful.  3 nice pieces of cod made with beer batter and really crispy french fries just like I ordered them.  It came with a delicious, fresh, non-mayonaisy cole slaw.  Nice.  Hubby ordered a medium rare hamburger that came perfectly cooked and which he claimed was delicious (although I wouldn't know if you know what I mean! )  Some people don't share.  I digress.  He also ordered sweet potato fries which he said were delicious (although I wouldn't know if you know what I mean! )  Get my drift?  All in all we had a very nice tasting dinners and the pricing was just right.  We think we definitely will be back!
Love love love this place. Meat lovers pizza is amazing!!! Bartenders are awesome...especially Laura!!! A place where everyone knows your name!!!

Came for St Patrick's day, making our way down to south Scottsdale. They had a rockin live band out in the patio and lots of seating, even a little standing room in case there are no open tables. It's definitely an older crowd and more laid back, I'd say averaging 50's. Didn't try the food but grabbed some drinks at the bar and service was pretty quick! Lots of TVs outside to watch sports games.

This place was recommended by our friend Jay Lessard, who is a regular, and it did not disappoint! Great atmosphere, tasty food, good pricing. Visit, you will not be disappointed! Try the prime rib wrap!
I'm from NYC in town on Vacation checked this place out... Because of yelp reviews and was not disappointed great food and great service. A+++

Love this restaurant and one of my favorite spots for food and beverage!  Staff is attentive and friendly!  Bar staff  always adds to the experience.  The southwest chicken salad and the pizza...any pizza are two favorites!  Wait...the potato soup and the pork green chili are also to die for!  My daughter begs for the half baked cookie served hot w/ ice cream on top!

This is the best sports bar ever! So many tvs and the best food. I love the grinder sandwich. Dasha is the best manager, so nice and always willing to change a TV! I love to bring my dog and hang out on the patio.  Definitely try this spot you won't be disappointed!
Their Rancher burger is one of the best I've had! Great food and awesome service! Chris was great!

Love KO's!  Fun, friendly sevice, everything I've had there is good.  Try the southwest salad.

Also really good chicken wings.

Only holdout on the menu, italian sausage sandwich, the sausage was more english than italian... i.e. really no flavor.

Aside form that, burgers have been great, appetizers, jummy, and for those days when I'm really wanting comfort food, fried Walleye!!!

$12 Bottomless Mimosas!  Really, do I need to say more?
OK, I will

Service started slow, but slowly became amazing.  Is it a coincidence that I was more impressed with the service after each mimosa?  Maybe.

The brunch food was good, and the patio is nice with TVs everywhere.
I wish there was better sound on the TVs, and I also wish they didn't allow smoking on the patio.  

Great experience overall.

Always a comfortable place to eat, watch games and play Trivia on Wed.. Our server tonight was Dillon, he was one of the hardest workers I have seen in Years~ Always had a smile on his face, bussed tables, was attentive and is the BEST~
Thank you~!!

Horrible service. Its sad to say this but when you are going there to watch a football game and you cant even get a refill on your drink because your waitress has gone and disappeared and doesnt return to check on you. I waited and hour for me to get a drink. I waited 45 minutes just to get the check. She aslo said that when she came back with the check she would give us raffle tickets to put in....Never came back with those tickets. I think this girl should be fired i was upset to the point were i got up and walked out. She didnt deserve a tip but i gave her one. Her name is Angela. I was there on the night of the super bowl game. I will be back to that restaurant no doubt but I cant believe that someone would hire someone like that. Horrible service.

Pretty good place for happy hour, though the happy hour menu is limited. I ordered the pretzel bites with cheese. The cheese was a weird brown-orange color but kind of spicy. It was good. I also ordered the hummus platter, which comes with regular hummus as well as red pepper hummus. The regular hummus was on the dry side and kind of bland. The pita bread was dry too.

There is nothing really stand out about this place.  The service is crap, the food is overpriced and underflavored and its expensive for bar food.  

I believe this place is frequented as it has prime real estate right on Northsight and you can see it from the road.  Aside from that there is nothing.  Go to one of the neighboring establishments and you will fair better.
Paige was a great service technician of culinary extravaganza delight.. She adhered to our beckon' call.

Omg!  The King's Cakes are nothing short of amazing.  Pancakes with peanut butter, chocolate and bananas.  It makes a pancake neutral person find love!  Yummy.  Omelette was good too.  Service was ok.

AWESOME bar! The food is not great with the exception of the pizza slices served late night (for a buck!!!), but the drinks are good and they usually have great specials. The best part is the bus that will take you home for free if you live within a few miles and can not drive yourself. The bus makes this bar top notch in my eyes!

Fun night, great food- my new go to place for Football season and any other time!  The hostesses were very friendly our server was so attentive  and friendly. I had the pulled pork sliders and my friend had the grilled cheese..... so delish. The coleslaw that came with my sliders was awesome. Lots of tv's so you can watch multiple games. Love this place!!

Upscale bar food, TVs everywhere you look, perfectly poured cocktails, ice cold draft and bottled beers, smiling faces, friendly staff, exceptional service!!!... What more could you ask for in a sports bar. 

It's a great place to meet for happy hour or hang out late night. Meet your friends or make some new ones. KO's is always filled with great people. 


There are nightly food and drink specials, happy hour M-F from 3-7 and every night from 9-close, Thursday ladies night, Wednesday team trivia, Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday free poker, and it's the absolute BEST place to cheer on your favorite football team. Let's go BRONCOS!! Meet me at KO's. 

Make sure and ask for Jane at the bar for a friendly smile!!!! She loves meeting new people!!!

This is a nice place. If you looking to catch a game the have what seemed a TV for everyone. Nice large bar for hanging or they do have a restaurant area. The outdoor patio is the place to be. Very well done and even a fireplace to keep you warm on a chilly Arizona evening. Drinks were good and I needed some chow. I had the Rancher , loaded with cheddar, bbq sauce, crispy onion strings and bacon. This was a good burger, the side of slaw was very good also. Service was good at the bar on the patio it slipped a bit but overall good time was had.

I have been going to K O'donnell's for a couple year now and absolutely love it! The staff has always been super friendly and inviting along with some amazing food. My all time favorite are the wings, which are SO GOOD. Would definitely recommend!!

Found this place on a whim about a year ago and we keep coming back! I know it may look like just a sports bar, and it is, but the food is actually so good and the servers are genuinely nice, kind people. We took my in laws there tonight and they both really loved it, and one of them is really picky... so I'm just saying. 
..Mother-in-Law approved. Ha!

Excellent wings and a very helpful Bartender (Christy?).  However, found the atmosphere on a recent Sunday evening to be lacking.  I'm 57 and I was easily the youngest person in the bar. Although in fairness a Sunday evening snapshot may not be a reasonable sampling.

If you're in North Scottsdale and want a good to great SportsBar experience I'd try All-American in MarketStreet or Cold Beer & Cheeseburgers in Grayhawk.

Very good service, food was pretty good, liked the atmosphere as well. Doesn't stand out that much, as far as being exceptional food or anything unique or different, hence the 3 star rating. Would go back again... in a year.

KOs has always been a favorite of mine. Surprise to me found out they deliver! Just ordered dinner to be delivered and was just as satisfied with the food as I am when we go in after shooting at SGC! 

Their deliver time exceeded my expectations, I am used to waiting at least an hour to an hour and a half for deliver and they only took about 45 minutes! I was very satisfied with not just the quality and attention to detail taken by the hostess over the phone when she took my order but also the quality of the food was the same quality I have come to love and expect at the restaurant. 

We had the Rancher Burger and a side of potato skins. Both were absolutely delicious and nice and hot!

Thank you KOs!

THIS is the sports bar you've been waiting for. It has TVs as far as the eye can see, and Off Track Betting to go with it. I visited here for lunch, initially chosen because they allow dogs in their outdoor patio area. The patio was cool even in the middle of the day thanks to the mister-fans. I had the triple decker turkey club. It was good, not great, but definitely what I was in the mood for. I really like that they offer an endless amount of sports on all their televisions and I can imagine that this is the place to catch EVERY NFL game on Sundays. 

PS: They have an ATM type machine to place your bets on horse races. You win some, you lose some. It's all in a day's work.

This is a great place to catch a quick lunch or dinner.  Nice atmosphere. Had the Black and Blue Hamburger on a brioche bun, w/grilled onions, it was delicious. Good size burger and could barely finish it.  

Here's the great part, if you're a member of the Scottsdale Gun Club they give you 10% off your bill. What a nice surprise. Lots of beers to choose from and cocktails that rock at happy hour.  

They serve other dishes besides hamburgers, like chicken pesto sandwiches. You can't go wrong here.

Was looking for another bar, but ended up here again. They have $3 Shock Tops on Thursday nights, which is a good thing and all the TV''s were on live sports, except the giant screen was on golf for some reason. I got food to go and it actually turned out good that bartender screwed up my order. Wanted Rueben with Turkey instead of Corned Beef because I figured they just use sliced corned beef that is usually chewy. This wasn't the case at all as the CB was shaved and crumbly, exactly the way it should be and it was another really good sandwich on marble rye. Lots of bikers outside though, never a good thing.

Laura was fantastic. I liked the way she greeted regulars and newbies alike. Very comfortable bar setting, superb service.  Pizza was super quick at the bar, if it represents the food you are good to go.

This place was a surprise gem!  Was out running errands in the neighborhood and my husband and I decided to stop in for lunch.  We were there right at 11 so we got to watch as the place quickly filled up with the lunch crowd.  Great beer selection, diverse food menu, and I absolutely loved my chicken burger.  Husband loved his burger too and we both stuffed ourselves!  If I didn't live on the other end of town I'd definitely come back!  Casual sports bar/restaurant atmosphere, very clean and with quick, friendly service and good food.
Always good. I get The Rancher. The sweet potato fries are awesome! Chris was a great server too ;)

Love, love, love their buffalo grilled wings and buffalo chicken strips.  The only other thing I've had was the pizza and it was, eh, okay.

They do have a great happy hour, if you like margaritas.  

Service is good.

The Rueben sandwich which I had today was pretty bad.  The meat was salty, chewy and not layered on the bread.  The bread was fresh, but the meat wasn't good deli meat at all.  A neighboring table decided not to order it when they saw the sorry little sandwich.  The onion strings were good.  The TV's are nice, but they allow cigar smoking on the patio and that was truly obnoxious on this beautiful fall day.

Went here last night with coworkers.  Great happy hour prices.  Nice atmosphere.  Definitely a chill casual sports bar feel. Just got bar food but it was good.  Looking forward to going back for poker or trivia.

Great bar.. amazing pizza.. great wings.. lots of TVs friendly servers who pay attention to you! Did I mention AMAZING PIZZA? Reasonable drink prices as well. Every time we come here I have a great experience.

Had a great lunch here with my grandparents. I would give 5 stars for our server personally, he was amazing, totally played along with my grandfather's sarcasm, and was quick with refills etc (if you go in, he is the tallest one, today he was repping an AZ Cardinals shirt). I had the French Dip, so did my grandma, and my gramps had fish & chips. 

Now for the cons, first off the hostess could care less about seating us, it seemed like it would absolutely kill her to smile, when she wasn't smacking the waiters with menus and calling them "whores" loud enough that my 80 year old grandparents could hear (they are super old fashioned, I kept praying they wouldn't hear her). Then there was the random server who very awkwardly came to our table, interrupted our lunch to let me know that "I looked SO familiar, he must know me etc" and went on and on, in essence hitting on me in front of my grandparents. so awkward. Thankfully, our waiter came over a few times and jokingly tried to let him know it was time to go, but the guy didn't get the hint. That waiter continued to stare and make me uncomfortable until we walked out the door after lunch. Also, my gramps mentioned that the fish and chips were more bread than fish, though they had great taste.

OVERALL, we had a good lunch with our server, who deserves kudos for being so on the ball and taking great care of us, but the cons have kind of creeped me out.

I happened upon this place by accident.  My phone was being repaired at the Sprint store and I had to kill a couple hours.  I'm on holidays and didn't want to drive around, so I stopped into the bar for a couple beers.

I did not eat.   The server was very friendly and efficient.  She chatted when I made conversation.  

I really can't give a full review since I didn't eat, but I did enjoy the bar and the patio was beautiful!

They also have a shuttle service if you drink too much and need a rid home.
Staff is fantastic, food is great. The best place to watch a game and drink great beers with very good food.

Awesome sports bar with a giant and eclectic menu. The service is always friendly and fast. The staff knows tons of customers by name. Great pizza, fried ravioli, wings, amazing salads, pretzels, burgers (try the enchilada burger with fried jalape√±os). Tip- if you're a Scottsdale Gun Club member you get 10% off your food!

KO's is a great place for lunch during the work week! You get to be in a bar in the middle of the day (which is great), the place isn't crowded and service is prompt, and there are a lot of healthy options on the menu. 

All of the salads are great. They are big and they are full of fresh vegetables & good lettuce. I particularly like the southwestern salad and would recommend it to anyone as a satisfying lunch. It's full of cheese and tortillas strips which makes every bite taste yummy without making the salad heavy. I never eat dressing on my salads however the chipotle aioli type dressing that came with the southwestern salad was amazing and worth all the calories.

The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is cause there were random chunks of chicken in what was supposed to be a vegetarian salad. Otherwise the service was good and we weren't interrupted unnecessarily, which seems to happen a lot in Arizona when I go to work lunches.
Great service. Salads are fresh and flavorful.  Able to see a TV from anywhere in the restaurant or bar area
Usually I enjoy Ko's but the service was unusually poor this afternoon. I would stay away from the "spring salad" .. not so "springy" this time around.

I so wanted to bump them up to 4 stars because my sliders were very tasty, but I just couldn't because of the service. 

The girls on my team at work get together once a month to have lunch together. This month we decided to take advantage of the beautiful weather and have lunch on KO's patio. There would be 6 of us going out to lunch. I didn't know how busy they get during lunch time, so I called the day before our lunch outing to make reservations on the patio. 

We arrived on time and the hostess took us out to our tables. They have a huge covered patio that fits at least 8 tables and only 2 of them were taken at this time and they sit is in the one area that is not covered. Although we wanted to take advantage of the weather we are all in business clothes and didn't want to go back to work sweaty and possibly sunburned since we apparently had not come prepared with sunblock. I ask the hostess to please sit us under the covered patio and she huffed and puffed and said she would have to move tables. Ok, that's fine by me, thanks. 

Finally we got our table. After reviewing the menu for a bit we all order and then we wait. And wait. And wait. The restaurant did not appear to be too busy, maybe 2 more tables were seated outside (not sure about inside) in the 25-30 minutes we waited for sandwiches, sliders, a burger, and a salad. Nothing that should have taken more than 10 minutes (15 max) to make. So unfortunately, half of our lunch hour was spent waiting for our food. Luckily everyone loved their meals. I had the sliders (mixed the different kinds) and they were all great. The bread was soft and all the meats (pulled pork, prime rib, Asian chicken) were moist and flavorful. 

I'll certainly come back here for lunch because it's right across the street from my work and their patio is nice (especially those chairs at the high tops), but they just need to make sure orders don't take as long to come out during the lunch hour as many people only have an hour they can take off. And please always offer people the covered patio first before you try to leave them out in the sun.
Great place. Enjoyed the patio for happy hour followed by dinner. Good food and our server Rachael was great. Very helpful and attentive. Well worth the trip.

Mentioned to our server, Kristi, that we had never been here before...and she took us on a flavorful adventure that pleasantly surprised us!! Our appetizer was fantastic(wings and pretzels)...and our entrees were even better! I had a burger and my wife had the "dip"! Loved the beer selection...and the service was A+!!!!

Hands-down best lunch spot in Scottsdale. 
Food is always great, service is always great, and probably the best managerial style of any restaurant I've been to.
Very mediocre, very salty, very large portions. Meh.

I dig the super dog friendly patio.
I really like the setup of the patio overall - it's a very comfortable space.
The menu has choices for everyone and portion size is way up there.

The food itself is OK at best - relatively bland, overall. But, it's bar food in N. Scottsdale, so I think that's par for the course. Nothing bad, just a little on the blah side.

The service...well, um. Yeah. The service. I think the only requirement for employment as a server is to be cute. They sure as hell aren't hired for any of the actual skills needed to be a decent server. Reminds me of the staff at Ra Sushi and way too many other places.

That said - it's still worth a visit! Just bring some good people to have great conversations with and the patio will be a lovely and comfy backdrop for that. And if you're patient and, well, patient - you'll even get some good drinks and decent food. Fido will even get a water bowl!

Does a great job for what it is. The food is decent for a bar, the menu is extensive, and they seem very organized. I've actually been very impressed with the prices. It's very easy to get a bite to eat and drink when you're in a hurry. But there's a lot of reasons to stay. 

About three nights a week they have free Texas hold 'em. If you can get past the fact that it will be very packed you will really enjoy yourself. But be prepared for some good players. And watch out for Myrna. :)

They have a really good chicken strip and fries dish for the poker players that I highly recommend. 
I love the bar area, lots of great beer on tap and friendly bartenders. The servers are always super fast. 
Check it out!

We live minutes from this place, but have yet to actually eat there. We've tried before - once we went in at 8pm and were told the kitchen was closed. Another time we were told ahead that we can bring our dog to the patio, but then we were told that excluded us from happy hour specials, so we left. Numerous times I have called to place a pick-up order, and nobody ever answered the phone so we ordered from someplace else. Kinda surprised we even bothered again....
Well, third time's a charm right? 
We chose a Monday because of the 50% off pizza special. We decided to dine inside because there was a game I wanted to watch - I saw it was already on several tv's and when were seated the hostess said she would switch our nearest TV to the game for me. She never did. We had to ask twice and it finally got switched, but it already gave that "too little too late" feeling to our night.   
Our waitress was much more friendly and attentive, no complaints there. 
The fried raviolis were "ok" - seemed like they were frozen. Barely worth the $5 price.
The pizza was one of the worst I've ever had. I guess it was our fault for not sending it back, but we were starving and exhausted after a really long day at work. The pizza crust was undercooked - it was soggy and so soft my fingers could break through it when trying to fold it. 
I asked my wife - do you think all the pizzas are like this? 
If so, I don't think we'd ever go back, even for 50% off. Seems like the pizza got less than 50% TLC from the cook. 
We couldn't finish it, and we took the rest home with the intent of re-baking it on a stone, to see if we can salvage the crust and make it edible. Well the leftovers hardened within hours, it went from soggy cotton-soft undercooked crust to hardened cardboard cracker, like that. I've never really had pizza like that before, outside of a HS cafeteria. I've had frozen grocery store pizza that had a nice crust. 
This was very disappointing. Can't say that we haven't put in the effort to try this local place, and when we finally managed to dine there... we leave with a very "meh" experience. 

Seems like a good local bar to watch sports and have drinks, but the dining experience definitely did not leave us wanting more....

I would give them 0 stars. We are from Kansas. Newly married and wouldn't accept my husbands paper ID (given in Kansas until you receive your new ID in the mail) so he had his valid back up ID. They denied him and our whole group drinks. Talked to the manager and she stated "someone in the group was intoxicated and crying so we can't serve anyone" which is absolutely not true. don't recommend any tourist to this bar for to their inconsiderate service and managers rudeness. Oh and there was a rat who ran across the floor when we walked in. WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

We decided to eat for lunch. I picked the place b/c it said "breakfast until 2pm" and I was in the mood for eggs. It was a nice place when we went in. The food was pretty good and decently priced. My husband really liked the chicago deep dish pizza. 

Friendly Staff.

I go to a lot of sports bars since I am a big for of both adult beverages and sporting events. I went here with a group of friends to watch some football and enjoy some food and drinks. We were on the patio, where they had several big screen TVs with the games. The service, drinks and food were all great, but the thing that put this place over the edge was the atmosphere. Everyone there was having a great time and seemed like a genuine sports fan. I wish I lived closer so I could visit this place more often.

After the way the just treated a group because 1 person was unhappy, lets me know I won't be going there. Our daughter and husband live in Phoenix and we frequently visit and host large family parties but we won't go to this place in case we offend some whiny PC loving crybaby.

If you don't like smoke, definitely don't sit at outside bar. They sell cigars so they promote smoking. Sat outside at table with no smoking sign but it didn't matter. Four different people were smoking around me. 2 cigars and 2 cigarettes. When I asked why my table said no smoking they said yes this table but not others because they are 15 feet from door to get outside. Well 4 feet doesn't help. Duh!!! Just glad I wasn't eating like everyone else. Downed drink and got the f@!) outta dodge!
Amazing food!!! The southwest salad with Cajun steak is awesome!!! The bruschetta as well!!!! Servers are very nice and food and drink service is quick. Come here often and will always!

I've been coming to KO's for years and the food is always delicious. I have several favorites but the Southwest salad with Cajun chicken is always my go to when I can't decide. I usually have it as a wrap and add a side of their yummy French fries. You can't go wrong with their burgers, pizza or their wings either. When I have company from out of town we always make KO's one of our stops. Last weekend we sat on their enormous patio, had brunch and mimosas. I highly recommend checking them out.

it was the first time my family and I had be here. We all enjoyed our food. There was something for everyone. It was nice to be able to go to a sports bar/ restaurant and everybody to enjoy their food.  Without feeling that they had to compromise. My son-in-law enjoyed his sliders and I had a very tasty salad I didn't feel disappointed. Nice evening out.
The food at this restaurant was delicious and affordable! I loved the mozzarella sticks and chicken wings. The avocado hamburger was very good. It's busy but the waitresses are great.

My friend likes this place but I don't understand why. All of the patrons are older than me. I had two Bloody Mary here. They are decent. I also had a breakfast burrito with chorizo. A sports bar is not where I would think to go for brunch. I just don't think it's really my scene in there. Prefer a younger crowd.

My husband and I are excited to have found "our bar" after moving here from Ohio! We are always looking for places where we can bring our two big dogs and enjoy quality food and service. We were able to enjoy the Cubs game on one of the many TVs out on the patio. Our service was quick and the environment is relaxed. The food was really good and I had a hard time choosing what I wanted to eat. I was even more excited to find out that they had trivia on Wednesday nights. We will definitely be back for the food, atmosphere, and friendly service!

I like K O'Donnell's, it's A-OK.

We have been here a few times, most recently last week. The food is basic sports bar stuff and good. We've enjoyed the Pizza, Burgers, Loaded Nachos, Quesadilla, Fries, Potato skins, Onion rings, et cettera. 

BTW, they have a nice selection of  beers on tap. I particularly like their Pale Ale/IPAs, including Sierra Nevada. The bar area has about seven or eight TVs going.  Just for fun, count the remotes near the cash register.

For some, one of the pluses of coming to KO's is the benefit of their shuttle bus. It's for those who need a ride home, and really don't want to take the chance of having a personal fitting for one of Sheriff Joe's pink jump suits. LOL  Also, be on the lookout for those blue envelopes that come in the mail... they have coupons for KO's inside.

This is a GREAT place to eat! One of my favorite lunch stops as you can see if you follow my facebook photos "Lunch With Stew". My favorite thing there is the Buffalo Chicken Pizza. mmmmm, mmm. Kevin O'Donnell is from the Texas Hold'em family of final tables and occasionally will play the tour. Super great guy and he also has a super great restaurant and sports bar.

This place is yummy and atmosphere is friendly. Their fries are crunchy on the outside and fluffy baked potato feeling on the inside. Chicken tenders are breast meat and taste fresh. Their fried mozzarella is also great and the sauce for it has a basil taste.

Worst experience ever. 
Leslie the "manager" should find another career. 
This place dropped the ball on my order hard, leaving us not only hungry, but made  me look really bad with my co workers. 
Do NOT order food from here if it matters.
Good food (especially the pizza & burgers) , servers & Poker on Saturday nights!!! The owner is are gentlemen and a pleasure if you ever get to meet.

There are so many good things about KO's ... I don't know where to start!  First, the food is excellent and reasonably priced.  The service is great, too! When I go in, I feel like the waitresses and bartenders have been my friend for ages.  Robbie is my go-to bartender, and recently was served by a girl Angela who was so great!  A couple reviews down someone talked about getting bad service and I feel like they have no idea what they are talking about.  I've had bad service before, but never EVER at KO's!
Service was incredible as well as the food everybody was super helpful and nice and the food was spectacular!! Definitely coming back when in town. Highly recommend.

First time at KO's and tried it based upon a coworkers recommendation. The atmosphere was fun and inviting. Happened to be trivia night. Although we didn't play, we had fun guessing the answers. Our meals were very tasty and our server Chris was great. He made recommendations when asked, Drinks were refilled promptly and he brought a to-go box without us even asking. We will definitely be back and would recommend giving it a try.
I really like the cobb or chef salad.... very well presented and perfect amount of bacon, hard boiled eggs, and all the good salad fixin's. It was a beautiful salad!

Dearest girlfriend, why did you not tell me about this place before hand?  K O'Donnell's is definitely your destination for game day.  The amount of televisions they have will provide close to 30-40 games throughout the college day and will have every game on Sundays for the NFL.  Came here for the Baylor watch party.

Service was pretty solid the entire way and the wings were epic with the grill finish.  They weren't crushing and just flavored very well.  The Buffalo chicken sandwich was also solid.  I'm not sure I'd come here outside of that, but the selection of libation and fare was lovely.  I'll be back on another game day for sure though.
I love coming to this place for lunch and happy hour. The food and drinks are always top notch. The servers and owners take the time to know who you are. This is the best sports bar in scottsdale!!!
Great service, brunch very abundant amount of food. Loved the eggs, potatoes, sourdough bread. Great drinks, atmosphere ok.
Great place for yeasty pizza crust and rubbin' elbers with folks who find Outback Steakhouse too snooty.

Came here for the trivia on a Wednesday. Nice atmosphere. They have a lot of flat screen tvs playing sports so I would probably go here to catch a game. Not sure if they play any PPV fights. 

Although the happy hour choices were a bit smaller than other establishments, what they offered were of good quality. They also had some good beer.

Totally disappointed by the rude and snotty hostess staff that greeted us just moments ago as we arrived to watch the super bowl. No hello or smile just, "Do you have a reservation". No, we didnt! Who would think to need a reservation for a sports bar or need one for a sports bar running a shuttle back and forth from the Open. Many open seats and empty spaces in the parking lot. What a total joke!

On Wednesday and for our lunch break, my colleague suggested we go to K O'Donnell. She's been there many times before and I haven't yet so we decided to go. Although many restaurants around our office area are usually kind of full between 1-2, I was shocked to find the restaurant almost entirely full at 12:30pm on a weekday, & most people looked like they were not on lunch breaks! 

We were asked to wait by the entrance for a few min and then we were seated. The menu is not extensive but has good options. Appetizers, soups and salads, burgers, sandwiches, and main dishes, etc. at first, I was gonna go for a burger with fries, but when I found out from my colleague that they were beer battered, I started looking at the menu again and this is when I saw the fajitas! I've been craving fajitas for a while and I wanted to try fajitas at a new place as I have still not yet found my absolute favorite. I ordered the steak fajitas, I was asked how I would like it cooked, I asked for medium. I then asked for no cheese or refried beans which are two of the many sides that usually come with a fajita. 

The food came out pretty quick considering how full the place was! My dish was absolutely delicious. It came with a big dollop of guacamole, sour cream and tomatoes & lettuce. It also came with a lot of rice which. I honestly did not like the rice. It was mushy and cold so I didn't eat it. The fajitas were also served with 4 tortillas, not the usual 3! The portion was just the right size. The food was really great with all the sides. The steak fajitas were $14 which is not too bad. Service was very good and fast so we are definitely going back.
Best bar food! Absolutely recommend! Great menu and separate dining area if you don't want to hang at the bar.  You will not go away hungry.  Always have great service!

Pros:
Food was pretty good, bartenders were attentive and the prices are average for Scottsdale.  

Cons:
Place is crawling with senior citizens and our conversation was interrupted by a very loud public trivia game hosted by the staff. No one seemed to be playing and it was hard to relax with a loud woman blasting her voice over her microphone.

Was looking for somewhere to watch the SJ Sharks playoff game.  We were seated immediately.  Friendly and extremely attentive staff.  They switched 2 of the 25+ TVs to the game and brought a sound box to our table so we could listen to our game.  

The menu is broad pub food executed VERY well.  The salads had marinated artichokes and other fixings. The french dip had a crusty roll that did not disintegrate plus grilled mushrooms and melted cheese.

We hung out for 3 hours and were never rushed to to finish or order more (we had 2 drinks each).  I also loved that the staff helped each other, so when our server got busy, others came by to ask if we needed anything.  

A huge positive surprise for out of town visitors.

Went again to this place last night for a little happy hour with my networking group. We reserved the semi-private back room for our group that would easily hold about 25-30. They had a few food items on happy hour $4 special; potato skins, bruchetta (I had this and it was a decent sized plate) and queso dip and chips. I decided to order the Chicken Pesto sandwich with the sweet potato fries for dinner; it was very good and I shared with my husband and it was filling for both of us. Our waitress was nice too; a bit slow, but the place was busy so that's just how it goes plus at about 2 min. till end of happy hour she stopped for "happy hour last call" so that was nice too. The reviews are all over the board for this place, it may just depend on the day or the wait staff - but for us it was good.
Great place to watch football on Sunday.  Food is better than typical bar food.  Lots of salads on the menu.  Also a kids menu and nice, friendly servers.  Will be back.

Yes, I am a fan. Particularly of the brunches! They bake their pancakes which makes them ooooh so good. The King's cakes are delicious and are baked with bananas and chocolate in them and served with peanut butter (which I'm personally not a fan of). The portions are very very generous. On a nice day, the patio is great. Comfy seats, evap cooler outside, misting system. Most people don't know about their brunches I assume, since the entire place was empty when we were there at 10am. The dinners are great as well. The pulled pork sandwich and their pizzas are surprisingly good! It definitely has a commercial feel to it, but I believe it's a local business which I'm all for.

KO's is our favorite spot in town! Candace, Val, and Stephanie are all amazing and the reason we continue to come. The entire staff (servers, bartenders, kitchen, hostess, etc.) are all beyond friendly and professional. Anyone who has a terrible experience here was probably having a bad day to start with and should stay home!

A solid ok.  Great location.  We were there on Trivia night - VERY loud - and busy.  But I expect a sports bar to be a bit louder.  Food was ok.  I had the Prime Rib Dip sandwich.  The meat - to me - tasted a bit old - not bad, just that it wasn't cut today - perhaps in the last day or so.  Wouldn't order it again.  Portions were large.  Dining companion ordered a barbecue chicken salad.  He only ate about 1/2 of it - said it was way over dressed.  He had also ordered cheese fries - quite a combo ;) - wasn't overly impressed... to me - they looked limp - but I didn't taste any so I can't comment.  Sodas were BIG and kept full.  Server removed items from the table without asking if we were done... one of my pet peeves.  ASK!  I am paying for it!  Just because I'm not actively eating/working with the food on the plate does not mean I'm done with it!  I'd go back again if friends wanted to go - but I'd probably not seek it out again based on this experience.  The Trivia seemed popular - but very slow moving - looked like 3 minute timers per question - and then a long delay between questions.  It would have driven me nuts to play!

The most awesome beef and/or chicken fajitas plate ever! I lived in California all my life until I retired in AZ in February of this year.  I know Mexican food. The fajita plate is the most fresh and tasty plate I have ever had in all my life! Incredible!!!!

K O'Donnells is almost like a diamond in the rough. It's not the flashiest place and looks like a typical bar and grill, but overall has solid food and a consistent experience. 

The grilled wings are delicious. The KO wings are a unique combination of cheese and buffalo sauce and I can't describe how satisfying they are if you are looking for a savory wing. I'm not going to lie, we go there strictly for the wings sometimes. 

The other food that I've tried has always been hot, fresh and tasty. Prices are pretty reasonable also. 

As far as ambiance, it's comfortable. When I've gone with the hubs, it's never been crazy packed, which is sometimes a welcome change to really loud and busy restaurants where you get ignored or forgotten about. The service at KO's has always been great- everyone has been friendly and helpful.

I'm taking my rating down from 5 to 3 stars because K O'Donnell's food has been inconsistent the last couple of times I have been there.

 I was really disappointed with the Forgetaboutit pizza this past weekend. It looked to me that the cook forgot to put Italian Sausage on the pizza. The artichoke was cut in fourths instead of in tinier slices to be spread upon the pizza. Yes, I complained to the server. But she explained to me that the ingredients are measured out. I think that the cook was sloppy and lazy and sent me an inferior product. The server, who was new, had no concept of what this pizza should look like. In fact, I didn't see any of the old timer servers in the dinning room when I was there. They would have rectified the situation.

 I don't know why management didn't show up, they would have immediately known that the pizza was just not right. I've been going to K O's about once every 10 days; I am definitely cutting back on my patronage.

I am really conflicted about KO's.  It's right across the street from my gym and the happy hour prices and food are good.  I also love going in for the bottomless mimosas on Saturdays and Sundays.  The sandwiches are delicious, but overpriced. The waitresses are usually pretty unresponsive, but the bartenders seem to be okay service-wise.  They provide a drunk bus, which takes you home (up to 5 miles) and has to be its best feature!  Management is HORRIBLE, both to customers and servers.
