I went here for my first time since I'm visiting from NY to watch Penn State in the Fiesta bowl. I have to say this may be my new favorite restaurant of all time. The service was fast and exceptional. The food was amazing. I don't even know what was my favorite and we got about 25 different dishes to share (group of 9, there for 3 hours). Their app choices are all very good. Prices are very reasonable. Chris our waiter was quick and was there whenever we needed him. Plenty of TVs and sounds boxes for the table, which I like so I can listen to what I am watching. I would recommend this place to anyone. I will definitely be going back the next time PSU is in the Fiesta bowl. We are!!!

My daughter was starving and some great college football matchups were coming on so I asked her to find a sports bar in Scottsdale with good food. One look at the KO McDonnell menu and we were on our way to try it out. Immediately they sat us at a booth where we could watch the game I selected, with other tvs nearby so I could glance at other games.
My "Build your own burger" char broiled and with onion rings was the best I've had so far in town. Barby was also happy with her buffalo crispy chicken sandwich with onion straws. My beer was cold and tasty. We will definitely be back.

Horrible customer service. Waited far too long for a simple drink order (sodas and waters). Manager couldn't care less when we raised the issue. Food (when it came) tasted like it had been under a heat lamp. 

Do not recommend. Would have had a better dining experience at a McDonalds. At least there I expect food to sit.

Candice is an excellent server, she made sure our drinks were refilled and the food to our liking (it was). The on duty mgr stopped to make sure of the same, the pork and the ultimate sandwiches were flavorfu and very large portions. We will be back!
l

This is an awesome sports bar with a wide selection of delicious food! The inside has all kinds of cool sports memorabilia, and the outside patio has a great vibe with many tv's to enjoy your sport of choice. We really enjoyed every drink, appetizer, entree, and dessert that we had. Definitely would recommend this place!
Great family oriented restaurant/bar where the staff is friendly and he food is good.  Kevin and his team always take good care of their customers.

For the record: I'm just not that into salmonella. 

We hit this place on a Wed after work for some snacks and a beer. We needed a fun place to go to fairly quickly because we have a little one that hits the sack early. 

It was still happy hour -it goes until 7, so that goes in the plus column, so we ordered quesadillas ($4 on hh menu) and a cobb salad to share. The quesadillas were really only worth about $4- two of the pieces had nothing but cheese in them. The two pieces in the middle had some tomatoes, green onions and black beans. Definitely not worth the more than $4 they normally are. 

Then, our salad showed up with chicken that was completely raw in the middle. All the way through every slice- RAW, PINK, JELLY. We sent it back and the server was pretty apologetic. 

When it arrived, the manager brought it and literally all he was was, "Sorry," and dropped it off at the table. Maybe I'm a snob, but if I had almost made an entire family  seriously ill, I would have offered to pay for the salad. 

We will probably skip this place and just hit Four Peaks from here on out.

Love this family friendly restaurant & bar. Love there happy hour there appetizers are wonderful, best of all they deliver during the day for lunch, it's the best delivery  so my staff and I indulge in awesome lunches a couple of times a month. Would recommend KO's to every one

Enjoyed my visit at happy hour after a visit to the adjacent gun club, and overall I was pleased but wish there were a few changes.  I appreciated that they had several craft beer options on draft, and service was good once I was acknowledged at the bar.  Mozz sticks were ok, not fully melted inside, and that leads to my concerns.  They limit the happy hour to only specific appetizers, which excludes the mozz sticks.  I love hitting happy hours, and there's nothing more frustrating than having that first beer in front of you and then being told the appetizer you're specifically craving is excluded.

This place was amazing for watching football on a Sunday afternoon! Before we even walked inside you can see the outdoor patio has a ton of TVs and they make sure that every football game is being played live. Then we walked inside and BAM sooo many more TVs to enjoy our Sunday football games! Our waitress was very engaging and attentive to our needs the entire time we were there! Another cool thing this place has are these optional portable speakers that can connect directly to the game of your choice so that you can listen and watch the game that you want to watch, super cool in my opinion and I think more sports bars should have this option because it was great! The food was awesome as well and the beers were great priced! Overall awesome Sunday football experience at K O'Donnell's Sports Bar & Grill! Will totally come back again and would highly recommend! 10/10

I had really high expectations for this sports bar. All the reviews are pretty positive. I am reviewing for my first visit because, to be honest, I'm not sure we will go back and we were hoping to utilize this bar as our game watching location for football and hockey. It's a great size, close to home, and has a great looking food and special drinks menu and decent taps for the beer boys. I was out doing errands and stopped in for a late lunch. I sat at the bar. I ordered the wings because I am a wing fiend and these sounded interesting and tasty. They first fry the wings like normal, then sauce them, and then grill them. I LOVE spicy foods, so I ordered volcano. The wings arrived with bleu cheese, carrots and celery. Some of them were maybe a little overdone, but not enough to complain about and as you will see below, I don't think that would have been a good idea. The wings were very good, but definitely not spicy. Not even a little bit. I asked the bartender for a side of the volcano sauce to dip them in and that helped. 
So, the food was good. Not fantastic as many others have experienced, but good. So, why three stars instead of four? The atmosphere in the bar was just...off. Granted, it was 2:30ish on a Thursday, before happy hour, so I'm sure that had something to do with it. There were regulars and staff and they were definitely taking advantage of the slow time. I didn't get a friendly vibe from most of them and they pretty much stuck to themselves. It wasn't nasty or anything, just "off". I just had wings and no drinks, so maybe that was the problem. When I asked for the sauce after receiving the wings, I felt like I was interupting. I've been a server and a bartender and my FAVORITE part was getting to visit and build a rapport with all my patrons, newbies and familiar faces. After all, that's how you get regulars! If we go back as a group to watch a game, eat, and order drinks, I'll let you all know. :/

This place was perfect for lunch, but took a bit longer than expected. It was busy and when the food came we figured out why. The fries....WHOA. Delish! My co-workers got pizza and had great things to say about it. This would be a place I would love to do happy hour some time after work. It's a very laid back environment with lots of TV's, beer and yummy food - win!

I truly hated giving them a bad review but one way to quickly get me to change my review is a reply from a manager!! That shows me that you care about my experience and not my money!!

Thank you Jennifer for getting back to me and we will of course be back to KO's soon!!
I always come here for lunch.  The turkey burger and sweet potato fries are the best! The staff is superb, especially Ian, Don and Derek. I highly recommend!

Excellent customer service.  Great food.  Accept reservations.  Live music.  I don't have a single complaint.  I wish there were more like K O'Donnell's. Made reservation for 12.  9 showed up. We felt terrible.  Wait staff was beyond kind and we tipped them generously.  We'll return. Great experience.
My first time here and I loved it. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious. The Mac and cheese was so good!! I'll definitely be back again next time I'm in town.
